etymology.description: Phonetic: 樊(樊) (fán) + Semantic: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") = climbing using hands -> climb
etymology.interpretation: The character 攀(pān, "climb") vividly conveys the action of climbing by combining the phonetic component 樊(樊) (fán) with a depiction of a hand, emphasizing the physical effort involved.

examples.chinese: 他攀藤而上(他攀藤而上)。
探险家攀登险峰(探險家攀登險峰)，追寻梦想之顶(追尋夢想之頂)。
examples.pinyin: Tànxiǎnjiā pāndēng xiǎnfēng, zhuīxún mèngxiǎng zhī dǐng.
examples.english: The adventurer climbs treacherous peaks, seeking the pinnacle of his dreams.
